projectData.task: To make a lighweight online showcase of my design and development works with convenient UX and centered around my work
projectData.whyExists: Design portfolios are often quite large, and if they are online, they might be slow. I wanted to make a fast online portfolio which is easy to maintain and whose speed does not depend on the amount of projects added. See the detailed exaplanation of design decisions below.

details.title: UX Design
details.text: I wanted to make an accent on my work, so I decided to build UX and UI around this. On the UX side, I wanted users to come to the contact section from either the main page or a project page as shown on the image on the side.

details.title: UI Design
details.text: As I wanted users to view different aspects of my work in a non-exhausting way and without constant vertical scrolling, I descided to use filters and horizontal scroll easy navigation to all the sections of the page.

details.title: System Design
details.text: I needed both user-friendliness and maintanability for the site to add projects easily. I decided to use Gatsby, for it is brilliant at static site generation, and this is what I wanted: to create project pages dynamically from a DIY template and a Markdown file. However, I was not satisfied with the rendering of Markdown in Gatsby (it is too narrow, and I needed more granular control), so I opted for JSON as project data files.
